intro: Eupatorium glumaceum, commonly known as white snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. It is known for its aromatic foliage and has been historically used in traditional medicine. However, it is toxic to livestock and can cause a condition known as "milk sickness" in humans.
